SEARCH
Package org.wmn4j.notation.access

Interface Selection

All Superinterfaces:
Iterable<Durational>
public interface Selection extends Iterable<Durational>
Represents a selection of notation objects from a score.

A selection can be a range of measures from a score, or a selection of measures from specific parts of a score.

Implementations of this class are immutable.

    • partwiseIterator

      PositionIterator partwiseIterator()
      Returns an iterator that also provides access to the positions of the Durational objects in this selection. The iterator iterates the selection by going through each part before moving on to the next part.
      Returns:
      an iterator that also provides access to the positions

    • subSelection

      Selection subSelection(int firstMeasure, int lastMeasure)
      Returns a selection of measures from this selection.
      Parameters:
      firstMeasure - the measure number of the first measure included in the selection
      lastMeasure - the measure number of the last measure included in the selection
      Returns:
      a subrange of measures from this selection

    • subSelection

      Returns:

    • enumeratePartwise

      default Iterable<Positional> enumeratePartwise()
      Returns an enumeration of the durational elements in this selection.

      The enumeration is similar to pairing indices with elements (e.g. enumerate in Python), but instead of indices the positions are handled using Position types.

      The contents of the selection are iterated in partwise order (see partwiseIterator()).

      Returns:
      an enumeration of the durational elements in this selection

    • durationalStream

      default Stream<Durational> durationalStream()

      a stream of the durational elements in this selection
